actors.name: The Apothecary was once Delia Deacon

Bridget receieves an expensive dress from an anonymous benefactor
The orphans throw the Dog in the fireplace

blocks.text: A yappy white dog that follows Bridget around.  Detestable to all but her.

actors.name: Bridget's dog is made of Grave Wax
The Apothecary harvests Grave Wax from Crysanthemum's grave
The orphans all hate Bridget Bloodwicke
The Apothecary ate from the Sangrenta Berry Bush
The Apothecary longed to be part of the community
Harold brings the Apothecary's jawbone to Sixstrata Chathedral
The Apothecary was banished from Gladhollow long ago
Bridget receives an expensive dog from an anonymous benefactor
Bridget sees the Blaze at Turnbull Cottage
Bridget believes she can melt the Grin
Bridget locks Etta in her burning room to lure The Grin to Turnbull Farm
Langua witholds the Draught of Purity from the Orphans
The Grin breaks into The Home for Lost Foundlings
Knowles flounders to keep the facade

blocks.text: [Banished]  Harold witnesses Etta's banishment and decides he must try to save her.

actors.name: Etta discovers that Sangrenta Berries repel the Grin

blocks.text: [Warpaint] Etta has survived in the Woods by painting her face with Sangrenta Berry pulp. It repels the Grin.

actors.name: Knowles blames the Draught for Mayhew's indifference
Knowles dispenses his supply of undrunken Draught

blocks.text: [Secret Heretic] Knowles has been hoarding his Draught of Purity. He doesn't want his feelings to be repressed.

actors.name: Knowles doesn't believe in The Grin

Mother Mayhew steps in after Nightengale's death

Knowles doesn't know how to make the Draught of Purity

Nightengale promises that the Draught of Purity will deter The Grin

Father Nightengale ordered the Draught of Introspection from the Apothecary

Etta is on bad terms with Father Nightengale

Harold cooks a Sangrenta Berry pie for Etta

Constable Knowles learns that the Grin is not real
Father Nightengale preaches that the Grin will devour the wicked
Mother Mayhew wants to lead Gladhollow in Nightengale's place
Constable Knowles is in love with Mother Mayhew
The Draught of Purity dulls passionate feelings

Father Nightengale ordered the Draught of Purity from the Apothecary
Father Nightengale invented The Grin to frighten Gladhollow into obedience
Constable Knowles assumed the Apothecary's identity
The Grin was created by The Draught of Introspection, Grave Wax, and the Apothecary's blood

Chrysanthemum's body transformed into grave wax
Chrysanthemum is buried at the broken bridge
The Draught of Purity is made with Sangrenta Berries
Sangrenta Berries are poisonous to the Grin

The Apothecary brews Draught of Purity
The Grin devours the wicked at night
